articles.description: Follow live text, in-play video clips and radio commentary as England play Afghanistan in the Men's Cricket World Cup 2023.
articles.title: World Cup: England v Afghanistan - clips, radio & text

articles.description: Listen and follow live updates as Man Utd host Leicester in the Women's Super League, followed by BBC One coverage of Arsenal v Aston Villa.
articles.title: WSL: Build-up to Man Utd v Leicester, plus four more games to come

articles.description: Ireland truly believed that this was their year, which makes Saturday's World Cup quarter-final exit at the hands of the All Blacks all the more devastating for them.
articles.title: 'All Blacks crush Irish belief as Sexton's story ends in pain'

articles.description: Rangers appoint former Monaco head coach Philippe Clement as their new manager on a three-and-a-half-year contract.
articles.title: Former Monaco boss Clement named Rangers manager

articles.description: There is more than just a semi-final spot on the line for England against Fiji in the Rugby World Cup on Sunday.
articles.title: England have chance to right wrongs against Fiji

articles.description: England pick up two Afghanistan wickets in two balls as Rahmat Shah is stumped by Jos Buttler for three, before Rahmanullah Gurbaz is run out for 80 at the Cricket World Cup.
articles.title: England fight back with two wickets in two balls

articles.description: Adil Rashid removes Ibrahim Zadran for 28 as England pick up their first wicket against Afghanistan after a 114-run opening partnership at the Cricket World Cup.
articles.title: Rashid makes crucial breakthrough with England's first wicket

articles.description: Formula 1's governing body is reassessing a penalty Lewis Hamilton received at the Qatar Grand Prix for crossing the track without permission.
articles.title: FIA reassessing Hamilton penalty in Qatar

articles.description: Calli Thackery runs the joint second-fastest marathon time by a British woman as she wins the McKirdy Micro Marathon in New York.
articles.title: Briton Thackery wins on marathon debut

articles.description: Wales will head home from France after they were knocked out of the Rugby World Cup quarter-finals by Argentina in Marseille.
articles.title: 'Loss will rankle but feelgood factor returns as Wales look to future'
